intro: Commicarpus stenocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruited commicarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody shrub form. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, dry fruits. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Commicarpus stenocarpus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
